## Description
The **SimpleIf **operator returns one value, out of the two input values, depending on the logical value of the input data linked to a third input. It is possible to define the expression using one or more inputs and a combination of logical operators.

## Input
**Input**

**Data type**

**Description**

**bool**

Boolean

The input value that you want to analyze in order to select the output value.

**value-true**

Any

The value that you want to output if the **bool **input value is true (in the boolean sense).

**value-false**

Any

The value that you want to output if the **bool **input value is false (in the boolean sense).

## **Output**
**Output**

**Data type**

**Description**

**out0**

Any

- The value linked to the **value-true **input if the **bool **input value is true 

- The value linked to the **value-false **input if the **bool **input value is false

## Settings
![](data:image/jpeg;base64,)

- In the **Enable Inputs **section, select the option that you want to enable:

**Option**

**Select this option to...**

**All**

Output the input value ***true ***or ***false ***based on the value of the linked data

**True values**

Output the input value ***true ***if the linked data is true; else, do not output any value.

**False values**

Output the input value ***false ***if the linked data is false; else, do not output any value.

- Click **Apply **to confirm.

## Special cases
In special cases, the operator behaves as follows:

Case

Behavior

**NULL input (no input)**

The operator considers a NULL input as an empty string. The system logs a warning event.

**NULL boolean input (no input)**

The operator cannot verify the boolean expression and returns an empty string, regardless of other input data. The system logs a warning event.

**Boolean input with NULL value**

The operator cannot verify the boolean expression and returns an empty string, regardless of other input data. The system logs a warning event.

**Boolean input with NON BOOLEAN**

**value**

The operator cannot verify the boolean expression and returns an empty string, regardless of other input data. The system logs a warning event.
